org.assertj.swing.driver

Class ComponentPreconditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.driver.ComponentPreconditions

  • public final class ComponentPreconditions
extends java.lang.Object
    Verifies correct state of a Component.
    Author:
    Alex Ruiz

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkEnabled(java.awt.Component c)
      Verifies that the Component is enabled.
      static void checkEnabledAndShowing(java.awt.Component c)
      Verifies that the Component is enabled and showing.
      static void checkShowing(java.awt.Component c)
      Verifies that the Component is showing on the screen.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • checkEnabledAndShowing

        @RunsInCurrentThread
public static void checkEnabledAndShowing(@Nonnull
                                              java.awt.Component c)

        Verifies that the Component is enabled and showing.

        Note: This method is accessed in the current executing thread. Such thread may or may not be the event dispatch thread (EDT.) Client code must call this method from the EDT.

        Parameters:
        c - the target component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

public static void checkEnabled(@Nonnull

        Verifies that the Component is enabled.

        Note: This method is accessed in the current executing thread. Such thread may or may not be the event dispatch thread (EDT.) Client code must call this method from the EDT.

        Parameters:
        c - the target component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.

      • checkShowing

        @RunsInCurrentThread
public static void checkShowing(@Nonnull
                                    java.awt.Component c)

        Verifies that the Component is showing on the screen.

        Note: This method is accessed in the current executing thread. Such thread may or may not be the event dispatch thread (EDT.) Client code must call this method from the EDT.

        Parameters:
        c - the target component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.
